Key Arguments: The legislation violates democratic and constitutional rights to freedom of speech.
It unfairly blames the informer for the actions of the recipient.
The bill could be used to censor information that the government disapproves of.
The development of a code of practice is left to the industry, excluding the general public.
No single government or agency should have a monopoly on truth, as perceptions of truth evolve over time.
The legislation could silence dissenting experts.
